primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from a lost state of primal innocence (Eden 1) through the struggle of history/sin toward a mature state of spiritual adequacy and faith (Eden 2).

tekstueel_bewijs: We can never go back now.
We can go on to that Eden where we believe...
You and I... cannot get back ever to the Eden of our innocent childhood.
a new grace and there comes a new power, a new calm, a new adequacy
the new Eden of faith in God

zender.identificatie: The Moral Order/Divine Law (and later, the 'Bright Presence' of Christ)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has willed a nobler role for this land
blessed it beyond belief and ordained that it shall bear his bright dream
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies with the Subject (the one who must move forward).

tekstueel_bewijs: by the power of Christ we can come to a new Eden
the bright presence of Jesus Christ
helper.rol_van_god: God/Christ is primarily a Helper/Instrument to enable the human Subject's journey.

tekstueel_bewijs: the serpent, the personification of evil
partisan passion, sectional preferences, and racist prejudices
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: While 'The Serpent' is mentioned, the functional opponents are the 'brambles and briars' of social injustice and the psychological trap of wanting to 'roll the clock back'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The National/Political Program: America's role in the world as a family of humankind.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: America
secundair_narratief_programma.object: God's bright dream of a family of humankind
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The individual spiritual journey to 'New Eden' is fused with the socio-political progress of the United States.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord God planted a garden
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We can live in the new Eden
We can go on to that Eden

voorbeelden: Woe to us if we fail him
They must go through brambles and briars
the craving for peace in our hearts
knowing all there is to know of the world's ugliness
We know now that partisan passion...
the Lord will make us sufficient
we can come to a new Eden

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the human desire (Vouloir) to return to the past and the necessity (Devoir) to move forward, using Christ as the means to achieve the power (Pouvoir) to do so.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: S1 (Innocence) → S2 (Judgment/Loss) → ~S1 (Realism/Knowledge of Evil) → S1 (Mature Faith).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in human 'adequacy' through Christ's help, rather than a substitutionary act.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; judgment is seen as an 'ominous sound' that forces progress rather than a death requiring a Savior.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of grace, the 'engine' is the human subject moving from innocence to maturity. Christ is the 'bright presence' that makes us 'sufficient' for our own journey.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord will make us sufficient unto whatever we must face and do
Woe to us if we fail him.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Presence of Christ in the struggle
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Between the two gardens there is... the bright presence of Jesus Christ.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Adam and Eve serve as the archetypal 'innocents' whose failure is the model for our own loss of childhood simplicity.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on God as the one who, despite human betrayal, pursues the sinner (Francis Thompson quote) and provides the New Jerusalem as a gift, not a destination of 'mature wisdom'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to be 'mature' and 'sufficient' through faith.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Sanctification is viewed as a human progression toward 'adequacy' rather than a death and resurrection.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the Garden of Eden to the American political landscape is rhetorically smooth but theologically jarring.
spanning_punten: The shift from the 'Fall of Man' to 'American prejudices' as the primary obstacle.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: knowing all there is to know... there comes a new grace and there comes a new power

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'power of Christ' is an endowment to help the human subject reach the goal.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is 'overstretching' or 'passing the bounds,' leading to a loss of 'innocence' rather than spiritual death.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the hearer as the Subject of the move toward the 'New Eden,' with Christ acting as a Helper (Adjuvant) rather than the Subject of the salvation event.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the one who must 'go on' and 'live in' the new Eden.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Christ the Subject who brings the New Eden to the hearer.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We can go on to that Eden,' use 'Christ has broken the flaming sword to bring the New Eden to us.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'river of life' as a gift proceeding from the throne, not a reward for 'mature wisdom'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Dominant Devoir (Must move on) and Vouloir (Longing).
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase Pouvoir (God's absolute power to save).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on the 'unhurrying chase' of God as the primary action.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Present Sin as a 'Heavy Opponent' (Death/Enmity) that only a Divine Subject can overcome.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: Without a heavy opponent, grace becomes 'adequacy' rather than 'rescue'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The secondary program (National ethics) threatens to swallow the primary program (Soteriology).
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ground the hope for the nation strictly in the finished work of Christ, not in the 'mature wisdom' of the citizens.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically beautiful and contains strong elements of the 'pursuing God,' but it risks turning the Gospel into a psychological journey toward maturity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is a masterpiece of 'mood' and 'nostalgia'; semiotically, it reveals a shift of agency from God to the 'man of faith'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the Genesis text; Greimas shows how the text is used as a springboard for a narrative about American progress and personal maturity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that 'Christ' is functioning as a Helper (Adjuvant) to the human Subject, which is the hallmark of semiotic moralism.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the Francis Thompson poem to provide the 'Grace' element, but the preacher's application returns to human effort/adequacy.
